messages.message:
Hey all, I'm making a change to Crafting sandboxes: If a service fails to build 3 times, the service get stopped. You can see the error in the Crafting logs. This will prevent Crafting sandboxes from crash-looping. So, if a service is stopped unexpectedly -- look at the logs:

```cs logs -f <service> ```
(or go to the UI)
We usually need to pass in the `--previous` flag in K8s to see the error. Is this not needed?
Crafting sandboxes do not use k8s. They are a laptop/local dev replacement
